SENT.plain: A family including four members with decreased antithrombin III (ATIII) measured by a biological and an immunological method is described
Immunologically measured levels of other coagulation inhibitors were normal
In the antithrombin III deficient family members there was a history of thrombotic disease
Turnover of 125I-antithrombin III in a deficient individual showed the lower plasma levels probably to be due to a deficiency in the rate of synthesis rather than to an increased catabolic rate
